greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The viabin numbers of the self-conjugate integer partitions.
comment: For the definition of viabin number see comment in A290253.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
formula: { 0 } union fixed points of A059894. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 24 2017
example: 19 is in the sequence. Indeed, binary (19) = 10011 and so the southeast border of the Ferrers board of the corresponding integer partition is ENNEEN, where E = (1,0) and N=(0,1). This leads to the self-conjugate integer partition [3,1,1].
maple: a := proc (n) local i, m, r: m, r := n, 0: for i from 0 while 1 < m do r := 2*r+1-irem(m, 2, 'm') end do: r+2^i end proc: SC := {0}: for n to 3000 do if a(n) = n then SC := `union`(SC, {n}) else  end if end do: SC; # first part of the program taken from A059894.
mathematica: a[n_] := Module[{i, m = n, r = 0}, For[i = 0, 1 < m, i++, r = 2*r + 1 - Mod[m, 2]; m = Quotient[m, 2]]; r + 2^i];
For[n = 1, n <= nmax, n++, If[a[n] == n, SC = Union[SC, {n}]]];
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Aug 23 2017
